83276.name: Toddler's Cast Cover
83276.gauge_description: 34 stitches and 32 rows = 4 inches in 1x1 ribbing, unstretched
83276.notes_html: This shrug was designed to cover my daughter’s cast and arm, since she couldn’t wear long-sleeved shirts or jammies in chilly weather. It also kept her sling from slipping. The ribbing allows for a range of fits, including the difference between her two arms.

1053997.name: Face Mask Ear Saver Extender
1053997.notes_html:
This Face Mask Ear Saver Extender is designed to be worn over a pony tail.

Easy Basic Level
Written Pattern is in USA Terms.

Great for using up left over yarn.
8 Ply yarn and a 5mm hook is recommended.
For a soft feel I would suggest using cotton or cotton blend yarn.

There are no stitch diagrams or pictures in this pattern.

1112733.name: Bulky Adaptive Thumbless Mittens
1112733.notes_html:
This is the bulky yarn version of my previous Adaptive Adult Thumbless Mittens pattern! With chunkier yarn and a bigger hook, these worked up for me in about an hour. You could also use two strands of worsted weight yarn for the same effect!

The original mittens were designed with the help of a woman I met on Facebook, who was looking for thumbless mittens for her daughter. Off-the-shelf mittens didn’t work for her daughter or allow her to drive her own wheelchair. These were designed according to her size recommendations for her daughter.

This is a beginner-friendly pattern.

Final Size (Laid Flat)
Glove: 8 inches tall by 6 inches wide
Cuff: 4 inches tall by 3 inches wide.
1112733.notes:
This is the bulky yarn version of my previous [Adaptive Adult Thumbless Mittens pattern][1]! With chunkier yarn and a bigger hook, these worked up for me in about an hour. You could also use two strands of worsted weight yarn for the same effect!

The original mittens were designed with the help of a woman I met on Facebook, who was looking for thumbless mittens for her daughter. Off-the-shelf mittens didn’t work for her daughter or allow her to drive her own wheelchair. These were designed according to her size recommendations for her daughter.

This is a beginner-friendly pattern.

1119218.name: Variety Ear Savers for Face Masks
1119218.yarn_weight_description: Any gauge - designed for any gauge
1119218.notes_html:
Stay safe and save your ears with these cute crochet ear savers for face masks!

Includes 3 patterns for:

  • A simple, classic ear saver
  • A ruffled ear saver
  • A star flower ear saver

These patterns will work for any yarn and hook size, though what you use will affect how the final product looks. Each pattern includes what yarn weight/hook size to use for the pictured model.
1119218.notes:
Stay safe and save your ears with these cute crochet ear savers for face masks!

Includes 3 patterns for:
- A simple, classic ear saver
- A ruffled ear saver
- A star flower ear saver

These patterns will work for any yarn and hook size, though what you use will affect how the final product looks. Each pattern includes what yarn weight/hook size to use for the pictured model.

1130885.name: Mio's Mask Extender Ear Savers
1130885.notes_html:
Designed for my kindergartener who just returned to in person learning and now has to wear her mask for 3 hours continuously!
It also works great for adult heads/masks!

Supplies Needed:
DK weight yarn (2 colors)
Needle
Thread
2 Buttons (1/2 - 3/4 in)
Tapestry Needle
Set of 5 - US Size 1 (2.25 mm) DPNs
1 Circular Needle (Any size from US 1-3) at least 24 in
(You can use other types of yarn (doubled fingering, sport, worsted & aran) and needles (reduce needle size by at least 3 US sizes from what is recommended for the yarn)

Techniques:
Uses knitting in the round, Turkish Cast-On and Kitchener Stitch….all of which are actually very easy. Watch a few YouTube videos and you will be an expert in no time!

pattern_author.name: Liz Sheffield
pattern_author.notes:
Hi!  I’m Liz, the designer behind Different View Designs.  After my Mom got diagnosed with ALS, I was frustrated and overwhelmed by feeling like there was nothing I could do for her as she fought this disease. When she passed away I dedicate my business to serving individuals that needed assistance dressing or had limited dexterity.  My pieces are beautiful, because I passionately believe that no one should have to choose between functionality and feeling great in their clothes.  Each piece is then designed with thoughtful details to make it easier to wear or put on.
My first piece, the Marilue Cowl, is dedicated to my mother.
A few of my pieces are still available for free on my website, see individual listings for more info.

My pieces are beautiful, because I passionately believe that no one should have to choose between functionality and feeling great in their clothes. users.about_me: I’m Liz, the designer behind Different View Designs. I design Inclusive Knitwear. Inclusive knitwear for every body. Every pattern I design blends beauty and functionality. Pieces are thoughtfully put together to allow maximum usability for individuals with limited dexterity or with disabilities that affect how they wear and put on clothing.

1208154.name: Chemo Strap & Holder
1208154.gauge_description: 4 stitches and 4 rows = 4 inches in Four rows of 16 sc st
1208154.notes_html:
Pattern is for a cross-body strap and a holder for a chemotherapy pump, which the wearer can use for at-home chemo treatments. It is adjustable for the wearer.

Uses one or two colours of worsted weight yarn, approximately 1 skein, and a 4.5mm hook, or hook size needed to obtain gauge.
1208154.notes:
Pattern is for a cross-body strap and a holder for a chemotherapy pump, which the wearer can use for at-home chemo treatments. It is adjustable for the wearer.

Uses one or two colours of worsted weight yarn, approximately 1 skein, and a 4.5mm hook, or hook size needed to obtain gauge.

1227931.name: Stress Blob Flat Ball
1227931.notes_html:
THIS IS A DIGITAL CROCHET PATTERN NOT A PHYSICAL ITEM. PLEASE NOTE THIS IS A NON-REFUNDABLE ITEM.
Once you buy the pattern it will be available to download instantly.

This is a pattern for a crochet stress blob/stress ball. Pattern made by me @lazybeedesigns on Instagram.

The pattern comes in PDF form and has step-by-step instructions on how to crochet a flat ball shaped stress blob.

Materials:
-Yarn, I used Bernat Blanket but any super bulky yarns will work
- 8mm Crochet hook
-Optional 12mm Safety Eyes or black yarn to sew on
-Stuffing
-Yarn Needle

To follow this pattern you will need basic understanding of how to crochet.

Please do not copy or sell this pattern or claim this pattern as your own. You are allowed to sell the finished items you make using this pattern in small quantities as long as you credit me (Lazy Bee Designs) as the designer. If you publish photos of the item please tag or mention me on Instagram @lazybeedesigns

If you have any questions about this pattern please message me on here or on my Instagram account @lazybeedesigns

1278564.name: Autism "Weighted" Shawl
1278564.notes_html:
This is a “weighted” shawl used to calm a child/toddler with autism in stressful or overwhelming situations like a weighted blanket, but not as heavy or as large and easier to carry around. The size can be adjusted to fit anyone really by adding stitches to the cast on or knitting it longer. I used less than 3 skeins of yarn in this version using material I had in my stash.

Use your favorite colors or combination of colors.
1278564.notes:
This is a "weighted" shawl used to calm a child/toddler with autism in stressful or overwhelming situations like a weighted blanket, but not as heavy or as large and easier to carry around.  The size can be adjusted to fit anyone really by adding stitches to the cast on or knitting it longer.  I used less than 3 skeins of yarn in this version using material I had in my stash.

Use your favorite colors or combination of colors.

1279220.name: Dialysis sleeve
1279220.gauge_description: 17 stitches and 23 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette
1279220.notes_html:
I created this pattern by adapting two others:

Around N Around She Goes Dialysis Sleeve
And
Knit-y Gritty Knitters Dialysis Sleeve

Dialysis patients are often cold during treatment but must keep their arm exposed-this sleeve will cover them from the elbow down and help keep them warm. I made this for my grandma and she loved hers so much I wanted to share as I had trouble finding patterns.

This is a good pattern for stash busting as it uses less than a full skein for one sleeve-I made a matching pair from less than one skein of Impeccable Loops & Threads. You will need size 5 and 8 needles.

I recommend measuring your recipient if possible, though because of the ribbing on both ends this will fit most people. If the pattern is followed exactly and gauge is met, the finished dimensions are:
Upper cuff 10 inches circumference unstretched
Lower cuff 7.5 inches circumference unstretched at bottom edge, 8.75 inches unstretched at upper edge before stockinette section
Total length 13.25

Gauge is not super critical if you are able to have your recipient try on as you go, but I do suggest a swatch anyway so you know how many stitches to cast on.
1279220.notes:
I created this pattern by adapting two others:

[Around N Around She Goes Dialysis Sleeve][1]
And
[Knit-y Gritty Knitters Dialysis Sleeve][2]

Dialysis patients are often cold during treatment but must keep their arm exposed-this sleeve will cover them from the elbow down and help keep them warm. I made this for my grandma and she loved hers so much I wanted to share as I had trouble finding patterns.

This is a good pattern for stash busting as it uses less than a full skein for one sleeve-I made a matching pair from less than one skein of Impeccable Loops & Threads. You will need size 5 and 8 needles.

I recommend measuring your recipient if possible, though because of the ribbing on both ends this will fit most people. If the pattern is followed exactly and gauge is met, the finished dimensions are:
Upper cuff 10 inches circumference unstretched
Lower cuff 7.5 inches circumference unstretched at bottom edge, 8.75 inches unstretched at upper edge before stockinette section
Total length 13.25
 
Gauge is not super critical if you are able to have your recipient try on as you go, but I do suggest a swatch anyway so you know how many stitches to cast on. 


  [1]: http://aroundnround.blogspot.com/2008/10/free-pattern-arm-warmer-for-dialysis.html?m=1
  [2]: https://www.twincitieslive.com/fun/35527/knit-y-gritty-knitters/

1336891.sizes_available: Extreme prem, late prem, full term
1336891.notes_html: Knitted hat for NICU use for preemies in three sizes. Small amount of sock weight yarn needed for each hat, one skein will make several hats. Merino wool/poly mix preferred by medical staff.

1339505.name: Baby Belly Balls
1339505.notes_html:
Baby belly balls are a wonderful tool for lactation and birth classes. They show the size of an infant’s stomach at 1 day (grape), 3 days (walnut), 1 week (apricot) and 1 month (large egg.)

This pattern is worked in the round, starting with a magic circle.
1339505.notes:

This pattern is worked in the round, starting with a magic circle.

1351036.name: Knitted Catheter Bag Cover I
1351036.notes_html:
To some, the catheter bag is one of the most humiliating and obvious signs of illness. By design, the clear plastic bag easily indicates to caregivers the amount of urine in the bag. But it also telegraphs the contents to anyone visiting the patient. In the case of hospice, it’s jut one more indignity at the end of life.

The volunteer knitters for Hopewell House in Portland, Oregon were asked by the caregivers to create a cover for the catheter bag. The caregivers were thrilled with the design.

This cover is for a bag that attaches to a hospital bed and measures approximately 9” high, 11” at the bottom and tapers to 10” at the top. The cover has two tabs that button at the top, allowing an opening of about 3” for the the hanger and tube.

Using a worsted weight acrylic yarn that can be machine washed and dried, the cover is a simple rectangle with tabs on one end, folds over and is seamed at the sides. Buttons are used on the tabs. Generally a single skein of 200 yards is sufficient.
1351036.notes:
To some, the catheter bag is one of the most humiliating and obvious signs of illness.  By design, the clear plastic bag easily indicates to caregivers the amount of urine in the bag.  But it also telegraphs the contents to anyone visiting the patient.  In the case of hospice, it's jut one more indignity at the end of life.

The volunteer knitters for Hopewell House in Portland, Oregon were asked by the caregivers to create a cover for the catheter bag.  The caregivers were thrilled with the design.

This cover is for a bag that attaches to a hospital bed and measures approximately 9" high, 11" at the bottom and tapers to 10" at the top.  The cover has two tabs that button at the top, allowing an opening of about 3" for the the hanger and tube.

Using a worsted weight acrylic yarn that can be machine washed and dried, the cover is a simple rectangle with tabs on one end, folds over and is seamed at the sides.  Buttons are used on the tabs.  Generally a single skein of 200 yards is sufficient.

users.about_me:
My name is Belinda and my mission is making joy and sharing it with others. 

I taught myself how to knit as a teenager, from an encyclopedia, and my first design project was modifying a glove pattern to accommodate my dad’s missing finger.

 I set up shop in 2021 to sell products, then quickly realized that I can write patterns. I am having so much fun with this. 

In January 2025 I completed the Professional Knitwear Designer Certification Program with The Knitting Guild Association.

7401228.name: Ednor Gardens Ostomy Cover
7401228.notes_html: Crochet covers for ostomy bags lessen the noise that an ostomy bag makes. I had trouble finding a clear pattern for them to make a cover for my neighbor, so I created this one. This is my first pattern, so it likely has many mistakes, but if you follow it, you will get a nice ostomy bag cover out of it.

7420768.name: Apple naloxone cover and keychain
7420768.notes_html:
About naloxone:

Naloxone is the generic name of a medication that rapidly reverses the effects of opioid drugs such as fentanyl, heroin, and oxycodone. It is available as a nasal spray under brand names such as Narcan ® and Kloxxado ® (1).

An opioid overdose is a life-threatening emergency. In 2023, more than 55,000 individuals in the United States passed away from a drug overdose involving an opioid (2).

Carrying and knowing how to administer naloxone can save a life. You can learn more about how to recognize and respond to an opioid overdose by watching this video from the Mass General Brigham hospital or by reading this pamphlet from the US Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA).

Sources:

1) World Health Organization. Community Management of Opioid Overdose. Geneva, Switzerland: World Health Organization; 2014. https://iris.who.int/bitstream/handle/10665/137462/978924.... Accessed Apr 2, 2025.
2) Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Opioid overdose. https://www.cdc.gov/drugoverdose/index.html. Accessed Apr 2, 2025.

About this pattern:

This free, easy-to-understand pattern provides written instructions (supplemented with many photos) to crochet a cover and keychain for a naloxone spray in the shape of an apple.

Materials needed:

• Sport weight yarn in main body color – 20 grams (50 meters)
• Sport weight yarn in brown for stem – scrap amount
• Sport weight yarn in green for leaf – scrap amount
• 3.5mm crochet hook
• Stitch marker
• Scissors
• Tapestry needle
• Keychain
• Naloxone spray (ex. Narcan ®, Kloxxado ®)
• Button
• Superglue (optional)
7420768.notes:
**About naloxone:**

Naloxone is the generic name of a medication that rapidly reverses the effects of opioid drugs such as fentanyl, heroin, and oxycodone. It is available as a nasal spray under brand names such as Narcan ® and Kloxxado ® (1). 

An opioid overdose is a life-threatening emergency. In 2023, more than 55,000 individuals in the United States passed away from a drug overdose involving an opioid (2).

Carrying and knowing how to administer naloxone can save a life. You can learn more about how to recognize and respond to an opioid overdose by watching [this video from the Mass General Brigham hospital][1] or by reading [this pamphlet from the US Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA)][2].

**Sources:**

1) World Health Organization. Community Management of Opioid Overdose. Geneva, Switzerland: World Health Organization; 2014. https://iris.who.int/bitstream/handle/10665/137462/9789241548816_eng.pdf. Accessed Apr 2, 2025.
2) Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Opioid overdose. https://www.cdc.gov/drugoverdose/index.html. Accessed Apr 2, 2025.

**About this pattern:**

This free, easy-to-understand pattern provides written instructions (supplemented with many photos) to crochet a cover and keychain for a naloxone spray in the shape of an apple. 

**Materials needed:**

•	Sport weight yarn in main body color – 20 grams (50 meters)
•	Sport weight yarn in brown for stem – scrap amount
•	Sport weight yarn in green for leaf – scrap amount
•	3.5mm crochet hook
•	Stitch marker
•	Scissors
•	Tapestry needle
•	Keychain
•	Naloxone spray (ex. Narcan ®, Kloxxado ®)
•	Button
•	Superglue (optional)

  [1]: https://youtu.be/h-g6hw_YDzY
  [2]: https://library.samhsa.gov/sites/default/files/five-essential-steps-for-first-responders.pdf
